attributes.action: Conduct a vote to rescind the decision of the recent EU Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Analysis of the recent referendum result has shown that the under 45s voted to remain in the EU.  Older voters have no right to blight the future for the younger generations.

The claim that the UK pays £350 million pounds per week to the EU and could be better used on the NHS, was a huge lie, because they deliberately confused gross and net payments.  

Since the vote, Leave campaigners have admitted that the can do no more about immigration than the current government is already doing.
attributes.background:
The result of the EU referendum was flawed because:

Not enough weight was given to the views of voters under 45, and

The Leave campaign misled voters on two significant issues; the £350 million weekly contribution and their ability to control immigration.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what you mean by rescinding the referendum result. We think you might want the same action as this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133606
